page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The Local History of our area dates back to before the Domesday Book.There are many things of historic interest. The churches in Hennock and Bovey Tracey have interesting histories. Bovey Tracey Parish church was rebuilt by Sir Thomas de Tracey repentant of his part in the murder of Thomas a Becket in 1170. Parke Estate goes back as far as 1066 when it was granted to Geoffrey,Bishop of Constances by William the Conqueror. Nowadays it is The Headquarters for the Dartmoor National Park. Hennock is of Historical interest because of the mining of silver ore or Micaceous Haematite. Other things of historical interest include the Water wheel,The old Railway Track,Johnny Canns Walk and Longlands, a Tudor House in Hennock.
